title: I was in Seoul for 2 weeks
text:
I was in Seoul for 2 weeks and craved some Vietnamese food since I am of Vietnamese descent.

A little hard to find but it’s basically right around the corner. At first, I was looking for the restaurant inside the building with all the stores but quickly realized they weren’t located inside.

The staff here is friendly and helpful. I ordered a bowl of Pho and vermicelli. It came with a few side pickled vegetables which is typical to Korean meals, but I didn’t eat them since I wanted to eat Vietnamese food.

Eating here was almost like mom’s cooking. It was tasty and worth the trip. The broth was rich and savoury. The noodles and vermicelli were well cooked. Everything was excellent.

title: Expensive bowl of ramen, not
text:
Expensive bowl of ramen, not enough noodles but good portion of meat and nice half cooked egg. The broth was very salty and I didn’t find their spiciest ramen spicy, just a little heat but I would’ve liked a lot more spicy. Service was excellent.

I’ve had some very good ramen in bigger portions in Japan at about half price.

title: Friendly and efficient staff
text:
We stayed here a couple of nights and enjoyed it.

Our room wasn’t the fanciest but it was decent and thoroughly cleaned everyday. The staff at the hotel and restaurant were extremely friendly and helpful, this was a huge plus to our trip to Santorini. Breakfast was also included and it was delicious. They cook their eggs in different ways everyday and offer a nice variety of bread, vegetables and other food. The pool was always clean and was a nice place to hang out on warmer days.

In conclusion, I highly recommend this hotel/villa.

title: Good coffee
text:
I ordered an iced cappuccino but the gelato looked good. They have a nice variety of flavours.

My coffee was excellent. Strong and bold.

title: Tasteless
text:
I ordered a chicken gyros and didn’t like it. The tzatziki was tasteless and the fries were overly salted. The bread was decent but the chicken didn’t look fresh.

This is definitely a tourist trap. I do not recommend

title: Good food and service
text:
Service was friendly and food was above average. Taste was there but portion just a bit small for me.

Beer is a bit cheaper than Athens.

There are many restaurants in Oia so a little hard to compare

title: Great staff
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The staff working at this location made our trip easier as they were extremely helpful.

The staff working at this Best Western Plus are the best that I’ve been to this chain of hotel. Breakfast was included and was excellent. Breakfast here is 100% times better than most hotels in North American even compared to the 4-5 stars hotels. It offers more vegetables and real eggs, not liquid eggs. The 2 waitresses we had here were very nice and polite.

title: Decent price for Oia
text: We ordered a drink, Mythos beer and 2 small pizzas to share (marguerita et greek). Very good pizza and decent prices for the place

title: ATTENTION
text:
Be aware that when you order as take-out, you pay about 3 euros less than if you sit in.

We came in this restaurant and looked at dessert. They were 3.40 euros each. We wanted to sit in and share a baklava and mascarpone. We looked at the menu and realized they were charged 3 euros more on the menu if you eat at the restaurant. I asked the server why the difference and he said take is cheaper.

Needless to say that we ordered it as take-out and sat somewhere nice outside to the sunset. Better than the restaurant!

BE AWARE THAT YOU WILL BE OVERCHARGED IF EATIBG THERE.

title: Go early
text: Arrived early and try not to be behind those tours. They are annoying and bunch of people who dress up just for pictures... pathetic

title: Bad experience
text:
We arrived here and it was already quite busy on the rooftop and therefore decided to go on the 3rd floor.

We ordered our drinks the first time and that was it, did not get any service and spoke to the waitress after this first (and last order). This young waitress should get her things together because her customer service skills are the worst.

We paid and left for one of their competitors, spent our money their and service was excellent.

Your loss MS Roof Garden, next time teach your staff to serve your clients better than that. You’ve earned a big 1/5... only reason you’re not getting a 0/5 is because Trip Advisor doesn’t give this option because you would definitely deserve a nice little 0/5.

title: Great brunch
text:
We ordered the traditional breakfast and an energy bowl.

The traditional breakfast came with: 2 fried eggs, greek yogurt, vegetables, sour bread and nice variety of jam.

Great atmosphere and very cheap prices.

title: Good decent gelato
text: Decent price for decent gelato. We ordered the pistachio and cookie and cream gelato. Nothing special.

title: Great food and ambiance
text:
We visited this nice little restaurant at around 5:30PM and were a table of 2. We sat outside which wasn’t overly busy.

We ordered the plate for 2 (or 4) and a greek salad. To drink, just a beer and water. Take note that water bottle and homemade pita bread are extra even though they offer them to you.

We shared the plates and they were magical, excellent, delicious! The plates are big and worth the price. The meats were delicious. Homemade pita bread was the best. Although I saw the woman who was making the bread drop the uncooked dough on the ground and put it back up on the tray to cook. Other than that, everything else was perfect.

The 4-star is because of that woman and her dough on the ground.

Greek salad, meat plate, beer, homemade pita bread and tzatziki came to a total of 39 euros.

I highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Good price
text:
Good price and okay quality. I ordered 3 soft beef tacos and a regular size burrito. I tried different hot sauces: Carolina reaper, chipotle and their 2nd spiciest sauce. The carolina reaper is their spiciest one which I found not overly spicy,

Overall, great good for the price. The regular size burrito which is their small size is perfect for lunch. You also get chips and salsa with your order.

title: Beautiful village
text: Easy to find. Great attraction and nice little walk. A lot of shops and restaurants along the road. I recommend you pick up a map or use your phone to navigate through the village.

title: Decent stay
text:
After a month in Japan, I visited South Korea and stopped in Busan for a few days. What an amazing city!

Jay is a very nice person and extremely helpful. He recommended me a nice place to have a quick meal when I checked in.

I stayed in single as I felt like having my own little place after a month sharing rooms/dorms with other people. The room was neat and spacious, nothing bad to say about it. Bathroom however was a little dirty and was lacking privacy.

Recommended!

title: Not the best
text:
Group of 4 - We visited this restaurant as the reviews weren’t bad.

First of all, we had the weirdest waiter ever. He made the whole service awkward.

Then comes the menu and food. We started with a cheese and charcuterie plate. It wasn’t bad but definitely could’ve been better elsewhere. Plate was a bit small for the price. I ordered a burger platter - 4/10, not the best, but eatable if you’re hungry. I also ordered an IPA, IBU was probably very low, too bad they don’t add more info on their beers. Not the best beers.

As mentioned by another person, DO NOT take the crab cake. It looked overcooked and dry.

We ate and then left as soon as possible and went back to another restaurant on the same street where service and food were 100% better.

I absolutely DO NOT recommend this restaurant.

I also see that the owner replies to TripAdvisor reviews. All I will say is his behaviour shows what kind of service and food you will get by coming here. Looks like he doesn’t take bad reviews very well. Instead of being unprofessional, take the bad reviews and learn from it.

title: Great buffet
text:
I didn’t stay at the Grand Hyatt, but I went to the Grand Cafe for dinner.

First of all, the waitress who was responsible for my section was absolutely great. She provided an excellent service and cared so much for the guests. Too bad I didn’t get her name because she deserves to be known by her employer for her professionalism and great customer service skills. Service was overall very good from all the restaurant staff. I am very glad I chose to come here. I believe that the staff really made the dining experience beyond enjoyable, it was my best buffet experience.

Food was also excellent, very great variety of meat, carbs, but lacks a little bit of fresh vegetables and fruits. They even had crab legs and sashimis! Dessert... heaven! Again, great variety of desserts.

Price, a little on the expensive side but worth the meal. I don’t think you will get anything closer with the amount of food and great service anywhere else in the airport area for the same price.

Thank you to all the staff at Grand Cafe for the great food and service.

5/5

title: WOW, no joke
text:
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

I had been traveling for 5 weeks when I visited this restaurant for brunch after my workout at the gym. I was hungry and couldn’t wait to get some food. This one in my top 10 best meal in 5 weeks.

When I got to the location using my map app on my phone, it was kinda hard to find the place. A little confusing as to which was the Grain. I eventually figured out the location and it was already packed. In order to get a table, if you’re coming to a busy time, you need to go inside and add your name and # of people on the tablet, and then wait until a table becomes free. I was by myself and therefore was able to sit at the bar counter which faces to coffee machine and girl who does all the drinks and coffee.

Order is pretty simple. Since I went for breakfast/brunch, I chose the 4 options order: I picked smoked salmon, scrambled eggs, avocado and sourdough bread. I also ordered the daily cold-pressed drink which was beets, carrots, apples and lemon.

My meal was absolutely delicious. The sourdough bread was so soft inside and crusty on the outside. I had never tasted sourdough bread before and I will definitely make it when I return home from my trip. The avocado was succulent, they seasoned and added some nuts to it, and it so so tasty. One thing I want to write about is the cold-pressed drink, NO SUGAR ADDED, it was the best fruit juice I’ve had during this trip and I don’t even remember having something this delicious. I was sitting right in front of the machine and they definitely use fresh fruits and veggies and do it manually. I should’ve asked for more and more, pretty their forearms would be sore at the end of the day... just so delicious and straight from the fruits and veggies! When I first took a sip, I couldn’t believe how the mix went together so well.

I usually don’t give out reviews this good but this tiny restaurant exceeded my expectations. They desire the good reviews and I wish them well in their business. Watching them work while the place was packed and busy was good to see. They still offered excellent service and food, kudos!

The drink was 5,500 KRW and the meal 12,000 KRW. It is worth the price IMO.

Again, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this restaurant for breakfast/brunch/lunch/dinner.

title: Bad
text:
Good for street food but way too crowded.

The markets in Japan are so much better and well organized.

Worth the visit tho for the food. Try blood sausages and pig foot.

title: Overrated
text:
I feel like this is more a tourist trap than a tourist attraction. Tourist trap because many local businesses overprice their food and drinks, and products.

If you want to get the true feeling of a Hanok village, visit the one in Jeonju. Less crowded and great restaurants.

title: Not worth it
text:
Overcrowded and not free.

Bunch of people dressing the same way and taking selfies. IMO you can visit other great attractions in Seoul which are all free and less crowded.

There is also a lack of places to rest and get a break from the sun.

Take a picture and leave.

title: Overpriced and low quality
text:
Service is bad and staff just stay in a corner talking among them.

I’m a huge beer fan, but man Brewdog’s IPA are bad. I came here mainly ro try their IPA and their menu is incomplete. Usually good brewers have more info on beers than that. For example, % of IBU... absent here. Some just say bitter, but there are different % of bitterness... amateurs....

I left this location in Seoul very unsatisfied. I won’t go into the fact that their beers are overpriced. I took 2 large IPA (Jack Hammer and Jooyoungbang), that weren’t even large!!! 8,900 KRW for the first one and 6,900 for the second. That’s about $10 worth of small sizes beers.

I also ordered the Patriot burger. Oh man, did the cook not check the pan or grill? It was overcooked!!! Dry as hell. Fries were decent, I like them unsalted.

I am so disappointed at Korean breweries and this commercial brew pub (Brewdog). If you guys like good beers, don’t waste your money in South Korea, spend it a local pubs and bars, on local beers, not these so-called brewers with bad beers.

title: Beautiful
text:
It was raining when I visited the village but was still worth the walk. Very beautiful buildings, streets and alleys. Unfortunately there were a lot of businesses that were closed but fortunately there weren’t too many tourists.

Recommended on a sunny day.

title: Good
text:
It was a rainy day so I decided to step into this restaurant to take a look at their menu. Bibimbap is a must in Jeonju.

A staff showed me my table. The menu was already on the table. It had both Korean and English, very useful. I ordered the stoneware bibimbap and it obviously came with a bunch of side dishes. Just one side dish with the egg and fish that was a little too salty but the rest was tasty and good. The bibimbap itself was very good and a little spicy. I’d personally would make it more spicy but it was all good.

I had also ordered a moju which was amazing. Cinnamon flavour was definitely present.

I paid 14,000 KRW for the whole meal, which is a little on the expensive side but it was within my budget anyways.

No regret.

I recommend this restaurant for their bibimbap. I would return if I ever return to South Korea as I know that I liked their version.

title: Small portions
text:
Saw this restaurant on my recent visit to Jeonju.

Their menu is limited to 3 kind of Pho, fired rice, Ban xeo and what looked like Nem nuong (not sure, might have been spring rolls?).

I ordered the brisket pho and to my surprise, they only have a single size, which to me is small. It did taste like pho but maybe a little bit of beef soup powder added? Nonetheless, it was tasty but the portion was extra-small. There was almost no meat and little bit of noodle. They did offer me a second round of noodles which I gladly accepted because I was still super hungry. Also, no bean sprouts nor vietnamese basil, mint, cilantro.

Too bad tho because they definitely have a good concept, just missing a lot of things.

title: Tourist buses
text:
Tourists are killing this village. There should be a limit daily.

I traveled from Takayama to the village and it was a mistake. Wasted money and time. I should’ve known that the place would be packed with annoying tourists just by the amount of them at the bus station. Once in the village, they all get out and start taking pictures of everything! Selfies, selfies and more selfies. I went to the observatory but it was packed with them as well!

I really felt bad for the locals who have to live and endure these people on daily basis. For this reason I left after less than an hour and because I didn’t want to support the way the tourist office manage the amount of tourists.

Tourists: Please respect the local, stop taking pictures and going on private properties.
place: Shirakawago Gassho Culture Hall (Old Matsui Family House)

title: Good beer
text:
We’ve been to this pub on 3 different occasions and also had some of their beer at the beerfest.

The place was packed on our last visit and we sat at the bar. We didn’t regret it. Service was top notch and beer was excellent as always.

title: Good food
text:
I was here with my fiancé and we enjoyed our time here. Definitely would recommend this little gem of Moncton.

Food is great and service was even better. You feel like in a Mediterranean country in this restaurant.
place: Blue Olive - Les Mille et Une Nuits

title: Central park
text:
Central Park of Tokyo.

300 yen is the entrance if I’m correct (might be wrong).

The park is beautiful. Get there to see some of the cherry blossom without the crazy crowds. Nice contrast with the buildings and crazy Tokyo life in the background.

title: Overpriced and overrated
text:
Tourist trap 100%

Tourists here are too blind to see that local restaurants in the market jack up their prices. They just want to get their food and take a selfie right away, SAD...

Just go a little further and you’ll get more sushis for more than the half cheaper.

Don’t get me wrong, come here and have a look but don’t eat here, you’ll get ripped off.

title: Light show
text:
Nice walk up but if you are lazy then you can use the escalator. If you are even lazier, then take a bus.

In April there was a light show at night which was amazing. I was one of the only person watching it, yes, great! More for me.

Also did full workout at one of Busan’s outdoor gym.

title: Beauty from Busan
text:
If you like walking and get rewarded by a beautiful view then this is it.

If you don’t like walking but the view then this is it because you can take the “train”

Walk down the lighthouse and get close to the water, then enjoy the view and fresh smell of the sea.

title: Loved it
text:
If you are a foodie, this is the place to be.

Restaurants staff are not as pushy as the other districts in Busan. Prices are decent and I love those little food stands where you can sit in, great experience!

Love shopping? All the big brands are close and also walking distance to Lotte department store.

title: A bit overrated
text:
Gotta agree with some of the previous reviews, this place is a bit overrated. Don’t get me wrong, it is worth visiting if you have time but IMO not worth it if you are on a tight schedule.

Also, one of the sign mentions that Gamcheon Culture Village is the “ Santorini” of Korea. I strongly disagree with this statement, they are not even close to being a “Santorini”. Santorini is on an island and has unbelievable views of the neighbourhoods and the sea Gamcheon village is a bit dirty and the restaurants and stores staff can be a little pushy to eat at their location or buy their stuff.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful station. I went to the rooftop garden which was tiny but it was nice to be away from the crowd on lower floors (need to walk upstairs, no elevators).

title: Kobe
text:
Easy to get to from Tarumi station (about 1-2 mins walk).

I visited La Shomon and had made a reservation about a week before. I got there a little earlier but the staff were nice enough to let me take my reserves seat at the counter. To my surprise, I was the only client.

I had already pre-ordered the Yume no seto set on my online reservation. The server spoke a little bit English and I was able to understand it. He explained the cuts and showed me pictures of it. Now let’s get to the best part: the meat. It was tasteful and it melted in my mouth. Very good beef. What I was kind of missing is accompanying side dishes like rice and veggies. That set should include side dishes IMO. Overall, I really appreciated the experience but wouldn’t return.

title: Wow
text:
This was one of the most touching museum I’ve been to. It helped me understand more about the tragedy one nation caused to another one. Civilian lives destroyed and wasted because of the atrocity of a war.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

title: Decent pub
text:
I visited this pub on one evening. It was a little chilly outside! Fet good to be inside. We ate at the bar counter.

Although Japanese whiskey was on the menu, I was told that they did not have any available at the time. I therefore tried some of their craft beers. I am a huge craft beer and micro breweries fan.

I ordered a burger which was a decent size. I’m not sure about the menu but it says that the meat is from wagyu beef. I’ve had Kobe beef at a restaurant in Kobe which offered different cuts (it was amazing), this burger tasted nothing (not even close) to what I had in Kobe a couple of days earlier. I gotta say that the patty tasted just like normal burgers or even less flavour. Fries were decent, not a whole lot but they were good. Beer on the other hand, I’ve had a couple and they weren’t the best. Not the worst.

I would recommend this pub for a try or nice night out with friends. It had a very good atmosphere and staff was friendly. Overall, good service although it took my server a little while to serve us our drinks that we had just ordered.

I will not return (personal preference) but I do recommend it.

title: Nice view
text:
Worth the visit if you’re nearby. Entrance to tower North and South is free. Beautiful view of Mt. Fuji on the day I visited. Nice 360 view of the city.

There is also a gift shop and small restaurant.
place: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building Observation Decks

title: Great and affordable
text:
This Best Western is located on Boulevard Taschereau. At first, I was hesitant to book my stay at this hotel but I was surprisingly happy with my choice.

My room had a full size mini-fridge which was very useful as I had prepared my own meals. The room was very nice and had everything you need. It has a great selection of TV channels. Breakfast and wifi were complimentary. Breakfast could’ve been better, it was lacking fruits, I would say typical mid-range price hotel breakfast. The gym only had cardio machines and cables, not enough for me to do a good workout, I’m glad I had a membership at a gym not too far from there.

Overall experience was great, super friendly staff and my room was always neat. Great for family or on business trips, affordable prices. Down sides: no complete gym, breakfast could be better and the AC/heat unit wasn’t properly installed therefore there was fresh cold winter air coming in the room, nothing alarming tho.

I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: The best of Ottawa, connects almost everything
text:
This is what makes Ottawa so beautiful. You have access to the canal all year long, for walking, biking, running, canoeing, kayaking, skating and more, name it you can do a lot here. During the winter season, you have access to a 7.8 kilometers almost straight line of ice. Running or jogging here is great, beautiful views and amazing houses.

If you want to rent a canoe or kayak, go to Dows Lake and there are parking lots around the canal. There is also a small restaurant along the canal. I recommend you go there for drinks but don’t eat there. Food is overpriced and not very good. Just go there for a relaxing time.

Don’t forget to go for a walk in the Glebe, plenty of good restaurants, pubs and coffee shops. Also, on one side of the canal, you’re in Little Italy and Chinatown and on the other side, you in downtown Ottawa, ByWard Market, Rideau Center, and have all the major attractions.

This is why the Rideau Canal is exceptional. Don’t miss this on your trips!

title: Westboro - a little pricey
text: Nice little restaurant in Westboro. They are always busy and expect to wait in line. Restaurant is often packed. Food is good but everything is overpriced, even coffee. Portions are not huge. A little annoying that they have so many tables in a small restaurant.

title: A must
text:
I enjoy going to a buffet restaurant once in a while but find that they often don’t offer fresh food and are mostly too salty. Mandarin is definitely different.

What I like about this location is their large variety of vegetables. The food is also fresh and packed with flavour, not too salty. Very nice choices of desserts as well.

Service is excellent and very friendly staff. Make a reservation on busy days if you don’t want to wait in line. Prices are good if not below average.

I recommend this restaurant, very family-friendly.

title: One of the best
text:
This museum is so interesting that it will make you want to come back for more. The building is beautiful and well-located. There is grass on the roof and upper side windows is a morse code. Beautifully done!

Inside the museum, you will walk through different sections and at the end, you walk into a large room that has all kind of heavy military equipments such as tanks, trucks, cannons, even an airplane.

For parking, you can park outside or there is an underground parking lot. They are not free. There is a small restaurant near the entrance. Military personal have access to the whole museum for free by showing an ID, which is nice.

I definitely recommend you visit this beautiful museum. It takes about 2 hours to get through it, maybe more if you take your time.

title: Burger
text:
Very good burgers, good quality. Portions could be bigger and prices could be a little cheaper but everything tastes great, I've been here twice. Also, be prepared to wait on a busy night because the restaurant is tiny. Not sure if they take reservations but definitely recommend if they do.

Service could be better but it's not bad. Waitresses are decent.

I recommend this restaurant for good burgers. This is probably one of the best burgers restaurant I've been to.

title: Cheesy
text:
Louis' Restaurant & Pizzeria is located in a tough area in Ottawa called Vanier. They are just off Vanier Parkway and close to the RCMP headquarters and an office.

I first tried their pizza when my employer ordered it for lunch. Oh boy, I fell in love with their pizza. Easily the best I've had in my entire life. Their crust cheesy and amazingly delicious. I still remember my first bite, "Oh f..., this is good!!!". Every bite will make you want more, but you eventually gotta stop as this is not clean eating. Try to resist eating the whole box.

Prices are reasonable and service is okay. They are very friendly and treat you like family. I'm not sure if they are Italian but they sure do look like Italians (very nice people). I've eaten here at the restaurant but came here mostly for take-out. Take-out is a torture as I had to drive with that amazing smell in the car and resist taking a bite from the pizza is always a torture.

I absolutely you try this amazing restaurant!

Ambiance/atmosphere: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 4/5
Cleanliness: 3.5/5

title: Tuna steak
text:
This was our first restaurant in Lisbon and it was amazing. This restaurant is located in a very busy area at Rossio Square. This does not affect the ambiance at all as it feels very welcoming either in the patio or inside (we went here twice). The waiters are extremely nice and we had a funny one. Excellent service.

We had a tuna steak, a salty cod plate, 2 drinks and a dessert. The tuna steak was absolutely delicious, perfect cooking, perfect texture, amazingly good. Same thing for the salty cod, although I don't recommend eating it alone as it can be very salty which is the normal taste of cods. The reason why I'm writing this is they are not cheap on the portion. The portions are perfect, very good for your money. The prices are reasonable in a touristy area.

Ambiance/atmosphere: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Cleanliness: 3.5/5 (bathroom a little sketchy).

title: No gym, no ice. Front desk so-so
text:
Booked a room at this hotel for our last night in Lisboa. The room was booked online a month ago.

We took the metro to the Campo Grande station and walked 400m to the hotel. We arrived early and were advised check-in was before 14:00. We decided to wait and ate breakfast at the hotel and then waited in the lobby which has confortable couches. We then got our room at 13:00.

The room is nice, a typical hotel room. It has AC, a mini-bar, table and 2 chairs, instant-coffee, water boiler, and a very low bed. The mattress was a little too soft for me but I had a decent sleep. Bathroom is nice, good shower.

I was looking forward to go to their hotel gym but was unpleasantly surprised by what they called a health centre (gym) which includes a sauna but it was out of order at the time of our visit. The gym consisted of a treadmill and stationary bike, a stepmaster (which wasn't working), a tiny dinosaur machine of cable which was useless, and just one dumbbell of 5lbs.

In addition, I was looking to get some ice and was again unpleasantly surprised that the machine on the 4th floor didn't worked. I tried using the machine for 5 minutes, didn't work. I decided to go on the 3rd floor and a message indicated to go to the machine on the 4th floor... at this time, I obviously knew that the machine on the 4th floor didn't work. I then went down one more floor to the 2nd and, no machine. This was, with the "gym", a huge FAIL.

After this big failure, I went back to my room, slept a little bit and went to the bar. The prices for beer were decent and they had a nice variety of beer and drinks. We had 1 large beer and 2 strong beers, and 2 apple cider. The drinks were very good and it costed about 26 euros. We then went for dinner which was a buffet. The quality of the food was amazing. A mix of charcuterie, cheese, veggies, a tasty vegetable soup, and for the main course, pork, fish, delicious rice and pasta. To finish, there was tons of desserts! 21 euros per person for the buffet which is, in my opinion, worth it, as you would pay more for the same in à la carte restaurant.

Overall experience: nice confortable stay with good quality food. Down sides: no real gym and no ice (it was about 30 degres celcius).

Service: wasn't the best at front desk but concierge was super nice.

Would I recommend this hotel?
- YES: good food, decent price, nice variety of drinks for reasonable price.

- NO: if you want to keep up with your workout plan and want a real gym, you won't get it here.

title: Busy market
text:
Very busy market, mostly tourists.

Not a lot of Portuguese booth and there are usually long waiting lines to order your food.

Worth the visit but if you wanna eat, go early in the day or late after their supper time. Very nice location.

title: Nice seafood basket
text:
Very nice location just off the water. I walked by this restaurant a few times and didn't go inside as they are always busy. I was welcomed by a young waitress and I had my table just beside a large window. It was a nice view.

I ordered the Forrest's seafood basket which consists of a bunch of fried seafood and french fries. Don't expect fine dining here, they love large portions (which seems to be typical in the US).

Everything was delicious although a little too salty.

It was funny to see that they had actually opened a restaurant based on an excellent movie.

I recommend Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant! Run Forrest run!!!

title: Overrated
text: Bridge is often busy when you go on it. I also heard a guy riding his bike on the sidewalk of the bridge say: "go away, f...... tourists". I guess he shouldn't have been on the sidewalk in the first place. I then just walked back towards the side away from the bridge and it was even better, beautiful view of the bridge.

title: Lots to do
text:
San Francisco is a beautiful city and easy to navigate using the public transit system.

The Fisherman's Wharf is a must when you're there. It has a lot of tourist attractions such as street vendors, street food, restaurants, boats, marina, and way more. Expect to spend 2-3 hours there if you like to eat and visit an amazing city.

Overall, this place is one of the places I love the most.

title: Good for NB
text:
Thus restaurant is located on the Main street of Moncton. They have one side of the building which serves sushis and the other is the restaurant where they cook in front of you. I could tell that the 4 cooks were not Japanese.

Prices were reasonable and food was above my expectation. They also give you shots of Sake. Going there would be more for entertainment as they cook in front of you and you'll get a lot of flames.

Very nice restaurant and portions are reasonable.

title: Business stay
text:
I attended a conference just downstairs and had a room booked for 2 nights. We were also offered a money card to play at the casino (I believe it was only $20 CAD).

We had every rooms boomed for the conference and all of them were beautiful. You have a nice view outside and close to the Leamy Lake. My room was very nice, typical to Hilton, one of the top in the industry. With the room, my breakfast was included. The staffs are extremely friendly and parking is also included. The hotel is connected to the Casino Lac Leamy. They have cigar lounge, I didn't go but will do so eventually.

This hotel is pricey but worth it. You all the amenities within the hotel or close. Good for business, families and weekend get away.

title: Nice visit, expansive goods
text: Shopping mall is beautiful, very modern and a lot of windows. Upper floor has all the restaurants, great variety, a couple of dessert and cafes spots. Clothes and goods are a little pricey.

title: Beautiful park
text:
This is one of the most beautiful location in the Capital region. It is managed by the National Capital Commission which has their headquarter in Ottawa, on Elgin street. The Gatineau Park's visitor centre is located on Old Chelsea road in Chelsea.

The Park is huge and goes all the way in the Pontiac. However, the main attraction is located between the cities of Gatineau and Chelsea. It has 3 main entrances, located at Promenade Gatineau, Promenade Champlain and Promenade du Lac Fortune. You can get all the information about the Park from the information booth at the entrance of Promenade de la Gatineau and also at the Visitor Centre.

You can walk the 5km around Pink Lake which is crowded especially during Fall Rhapsody, parking then is nearly impossible in the whole park. A nice trail for mountain biking is the #1 which goes all the way to Tour à feu in Luskville. The beaches at Meech Lake are busy during the summer season. Everybody ends up at Champlain lookout but there are 2 other ones just below it which are less crowded.

You can snowshoe, ski, and recently used fat bikes in the Park during the Winter season.

title: Beyoncé - Single ladies
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in January 2017. This Hilton is located right beside the provincial assembly.

Overall, I had a good experience here. The only bad thing was that my room had a door which connected to the room next to mine. At night, the guy beside me was probably partying or pre-drinking. The music was so loud that I could hear every single word of the songs... I know that he really liked the song Single ladies (put a ring on it) from Beyoncé because it was on repeat. That song still reminds me of that night when I indirectly partied with my room neighbour. I usually don't complain a lot but that night I had to, it was annoying. I went downstairs, advised the front desk staff and was immediately issued another room, which was much nicer.
